translation.title: The Simile of Hands and Feet (2nd)

previous.name: The Simile of Hands and Feet (1st)

segments.en: 237. The Simile of Hands and Feet (2nd)
“Mendicants, when there are hands, there’s picking up and putting down.
When there are feet, there’s coming and going.
When there are joints, there’s contracting and extending.
When there’s a belly, there’s hunger and thirst.

segments.pli: Evameva kho, bhikkhave, cakkhusmiṃ sati cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhaṃ dukkhaṃ … pe …
segments.en: In the same way, when there’s an eye, pleasure and pain arise internally conditioned by eye contact.
When there’s an ear … nose … tongue … body …

segments.pli: manasmiṃ sati manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhaṃ dukkhaṃ … pe ….
segments.en: mind, pleasure and pain arise internally conditioned by mind contact.

segments.pli: Hatthesu, bhikkhave, asati ādānanikkhepanaṃ na hoti;
segments.en: When there are no hands, there’s no picking up and putting down.
When there are no feet, there’s no coming and going.
When there are no joints, there’s no contracting and extending.

segments.pli: kucchismiṃ asati jighacchā pipāsā na hoti.
segments.en: When there’s no belly, there’s no hunger and thirst.

segments.pli: Evameva kho, bhikkhave, cakkhusmiṃ asati cakkhusamphassapaccayā nuppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhaṃ dukkhaṃ … pe …
segments.en: In the same way, when there’s no eye, pleasure and pain don’t arise internally conditioned by eye contact.
When there’s no ear … nose … tongue … body …

segments.pli: manasmiṃ asati manosamphassapaccayā nuppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhaṃ dukkhan”ti.
segments.en: mind, pleasure and pain don’t arise internally conditioned by mind contact.”
